summary: Data engineer/scientist with a versatile background and a strong interest in social and behavioral sciences and artificial intelligence. Experienced in project management, data dashboards, machine learning and academic writing. Likes to learn new things and solve complex problems.

education.field_of_study: Major: Policy Science, Minor: International Development

awards.title: Brill-Nijhof Award
awards.description: Award given to LUC capstone theses which excel through their originality of approach, writing style and manner of presentation.

awards.description: Award given to LUC capstone theses which represent the highest level of scholarship according to several criteria, such as research effort, intellectual contribution, and societal relevance.

projects.title: Latent.jl
projects.description:
Created the Julia library Latent.jl that contains implementations of commonly used
Latent variable models (e.g. Hidden Markov Model, Gaussian Mixture Model).

projects.title: HAN.py
projects.description:
Created a Python package that contains an implementation of a Hierarchical Attention
Network (HAN) in PyTorch for text classification.

projects.title: qualtRics
projects.description:
Created the R library qualtRics to retrieve and automatically format survey responses
from the survey platform Qualtrics. This library is downloaded +-1.800 times per
month.

Data Engineer at Xebia Data

profile_positions.description: I am involved with the day-to-day management of our cell of 25 data engineers at Xebia Data. Additionally, I focus on supporting our junior colleagues in developing their consulting & technical skills.
profile_positions.title: Principal Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Xebia Data is a consulting firm that specializes in data science and MLOps/data engineering. I help clients organize, analyse and apply their data using tools and practices that work for them.

Training (given):
- Reinforcement learning – co-hosted a two-day training about the basics of reinforcement learning to advanced concepts such as deep Q-learning.
- Bayesian statistics – hosted a two-day training centered around the theory, implementation, and interpretation of Bayesian models.
- Introduction to programming in R - hosted a two-day training on applying best practices for analyzing data & running ML models using tidyverse libraries
profile_positions.title: Data / ML Engineer

profile_positions.description: We help the ASML D&E department with implementing MLOps best practices.
profile_positions.title: Machine Learning Engineer (via GoDataDriven)

profile_positions.description: Participated in a greenfield project to improve long-term forecasting of gas and electricity consumption patterns for thousands of clients.
profile_positions.title: Data Scientist (via GoDataDriven)

profile_positions.description: At Guidion, I helped to set up the data team. I worked on several ML projects, created dashboards in power BI & dash, and organized advanced analytics sessions and knowledge-sharing sessions. I was also involved in the hiring of four new team members (engineers and analysts), and coached team members on topics such as cloud engineering & deployment, python programming, machine learning, building dashboards and project management.
profile_positions.title: Analytics Engineer / Data Scientist (via GoDataDriven)

profile_positions.description: I built and productionized several neural network architectures that are used for protein engineering.
profile_positions.title: Machine Learning Engineer (via GoDataDriven)

profile_positions.description:
Data scientist in a team of finance researchers at the Toulouse Business School and
Ben Gurion University. In this role, I primarily managed and analyzed large textual
datasets using Cloud services and PostGreSQL, and also developed methodological
tools in R and Python that the researchers can use to process and analyze their own
data.
profile_positions.title: Data Scientist

profile_positions.description: Member of the Data Intelligence Team, a small group of data scientists that provide analytics for our partners. I worked on a model that performed phonetic normalization of English-spoken text and collaborated with the World Food Programme (WFP) to predict food security in Yemen using tree-based models.
profile_positions.title: Data Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Member of an academic team investigating the use of Cortical’s ‘Semantic Folding’ in predicting stock and commodity price volatility using close to one billion news articles going back to 2016. Responsibilities include:

- Building and maintaining infrastructure using Python, PostGreSQL, Docker and Google Cloud Services to process historical and current news articles using Cortical’s semantic folding algorithm.
- Aid in collecting and preprocessing training data to create custom models using Cortical’s semantic folding algorithm.
- Design and implement downstream tests to assess the usefulness of custom models, using e.g. monte carlo simulations, clustering methods and convolutional/recurrent neural networks.
- Provide support to other researchers in terms of statistical expertise and by creating custom docker applications that simplify the access to the custom models.
profile_positions.title: Research intern
